reviews.review: It's an easy game to understand unless you don't have object permanence. You go in the Blue--You come out the Orange. You jump in the Orange--You fly out the Blue. Also, it's the greatest puzzle-game ever made.

i finished the game last night and this was seriously the best game i played in ages. the gameplay itself was a pain sometimes, but i think thats just because i suck at puzzle games. well written story, well executed character development,  great soundtrack, amazing animations and a lot more. 
this game has like the best ending in all of gaming history. i think it wrapped up chell's story very well but it would be great to see a third game one day. if portal 3 ever actually becomes a thing, i hope wheatley and the space core will be in it somehow

Where do I even start? This game is phenomenal. From the characters to the story all the way down to the level design and puzzles, this game never fails to impress.
The story is fantastic, getting to learn more about Aperture and the backstory of GLaDOS was something I wanted to know for ages after playing the original.
The characters are the cherry on top though. Wheatley is hilarious, and GLaDOS is well, do I even need to explain?
And Co-Op. The hours I spent in Co-Op with my friends and family are something I'll never forget. The amount of times I had to explain what a portal gun was and how to use it, how to solve puzzles, and everything in between are things I won't forget ever.

10/10, fantastic game.
